page.title: 11Tourism
page.content: {Welsh Mountain Zoo. The annual cost of running the zoo is a quarter of a million pounds.The cost of a single elephant's keep is around Â£3,000 a year.In 1983 to help meet these costs and to keep the zoo viable the zoo was taken over by,and became the base of the{Zoological society of {Wales}.The Society is dedicated to work in the fields of education and conservation. {Future plans}for the zoo include a new chimpanzee exhibit called {Chimpanzee {World.}Fund raising events for this project were launched in July 1985 with the hope that the work could begin in 1986.Other plans include an otter complex and an adventure playground.
